attributes.action: Create a day of national mourning & the Bluebell the Flower for covid victims.
attributes.additional_details: It has become apparent during the covid19 outbreak that the keyworkers in this country during this crisis are soldiers in their own right. Some have given the Ultimate sacrifice and should be recognised as the soldiers in this war. But we should also take a day to mourn those who have lost their lives. Many whose families have not had a proper funeral. But we also need to be able to show national thanks and praise for all keyworkers. Make the bluebell the national flower of thanks for carers.
attributes.background: Allocate a day, as a national day of mourning for those whose lives were taken during the covid19. Buikd a Memorial for keyworkers who gave their lives & a national memorial to those national victims & a festival of thanks for keyworkers and make the bluebell flower the national symbol of thanks.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action:

National holiday of remembrance of those who died during the virus covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/311923

Award posthumous medals to NHS and other frontline workers; victims of covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312389 

A memorial for NHS, care, allied professionals, who die as a result of COVID:19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313328  

The Government and Parlaiment aren't responsible for designating symbols, such as flowers to be used as a memorial.
